title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the University of Louisville, and it was a drawn out process. I sat through 3 interviews and it took over a month and a half. Overall, it just seemed unorganized. I ended up deciding to stay at my current position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you failed

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Virtual meeting over Teams and lasted about 45 minutes. It was a panel of 4 people but didn't include the person who would actually be my direct manager which I thought was unusual.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position, questions about how I handle stress, my previous experience

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: I found the process of this interview to be a good one. They were thorough and asked good questions about my past jobs and experience. They explained the job well.
Interview Questions: What was a challenge you had in the past?

title: LSAMP STEM Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was an online interview, the interview was purely behavioral questions. It was conducted by two members, one of which was the president of the organization and the other in a junior position. The interview was 25 to 30 minutes in length.
Interview Questions: When was a time when you had to ask for help?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: It was one round phone interview with the professir and all about my research background. The same day that I did the interview,  I was selected. I received and email and was instructed to the next steps for hiring process.
Interview Questions: What did you do during your phd.

title: Part-time Sales Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: This is a panel interviewing process.  You meet with two people from the office and three people from other departments.  The interview is informal but can be intimidating at points.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: It was a single phone call. I got acceptance few minutes after the call. It was easy 30 minutes interview. They just asked about the previous projects that I have done. Then some behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions:
A well organized plan of discussions with senior individuals, within the program  applying for.
I felt like I was given a chance to speak to my strengths to many levels of professionals I. The process.
Interview Questions: If you had a donor who had made a gift and not been appropriately followed up with, what would you do?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: I met the whole team. It was a nice way to see how they interacted with each other. It was a little overwhelming at times, but I appreciated that they included advisors, supervisors, and other positions in their office too.
Interview Questions: What is your goal in higher education?

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was an unorthodox interview, because I was a nursing student and immediately offered me a job. They ask me why do I want to work a the emergency department.
Interview Questions: I am a nursing student, they just went to the point and offer me job

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process wasn’t bad. Typical questions and nothing out of the ordinary. I met with several groups in person after having a phone interview. It was a half day in person interview which was a pleasant surprise.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to use critical thinking skills?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Very short interview process. They looked at my resume prior to the interview but we barely discussed anything on my resume. Very welcoming and friendly atmosphere. I would recommend students at UofL apply for jobs at UofL.
Interview Questions: Why are interested in this position?

title: CTC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: First you will complete an interview with hiring manager. You will then complete an interview with members of the team. Then they will call you to tell you the decision.
Interview Questions: Please explain a time you had to act as a leader of a team.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: There were four interviews in one day. One with the hiring committee, staff, director, and supervisor. Each interview was schedule for 45 minutes via teams. There were about 10 people on the hiring committee about 10 staff for that interview.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Ticket Sales Account Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a great process and even though I wasn’t hired, I felt that they did their due diligence. I would apply to work there again because of this experience
Interview Questions: Give me and example of how you’ve won a sale

title: Senior Academic Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was an interesting process. Since it was virtual there were several different ways of how each interview went. One involves other people from the company and the other is a series of questions reviewed by the company pre-recorded
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you

title: Athletics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The application process went by quick and the administrator was in contact after a day of submission. The interview consisted of scenarios of what would you do in this situation.
Interview Questions: What would you do when a student asks you to write a paper for them or ask for help in taking an exam?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Be asked a question about teamwork and how to deal with others, also show acknowledgment for different walks of life for people that might live in residence halls. Also be able to answer typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: How would you incorporate the people with different diversity.

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: No interview was required prior to the admission. SOmetimes skype or phone interview with the admission committee. You have to interview the professor of your interest once you join.It was overall a wonderful experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technology Transfer Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a group phone interview - followed up a 1/2 day in person interview with staff members, relevant faculty members, and upper level administration.  Questions were to assess skills as well as personal fit within the office.
Interview Questions: Tell us what you know about our office and what we do.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Round table interview & Presentation ; and the whole  process was about two hours.  The hiring committee members took turns to ask questions. So did the presentation part too.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply this position?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The simple interview process was upbeat and focused on how your personality can fit into the organization's needs. I was hired basically as I left the Director's office and formally offered a position within 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that your skillset was put to the test

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact came within 1 1/2 months of submitting online application. First interview was a Skype interview with the hiring committee. About three weeks later, the on-campus Interview happened with the Academic Advising staff, Hiring Committee, and also the Director of the unit. In addition, I had to present a short presentation on "How to be a successful college student." Overall, a very positive interviewing experience even though I was not offered the position.
Interview Questions: Please give an example of a time you have had to give bad news to a student. How did you handle it and why?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Resume screen, a brief interview with peers, and an individual who will probably be your boss. They were very kind and wanted to make sure you were comfortable! I would not be worried about the interview.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you would change about the University of Louisville?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email for a phone interview. The interviewer called on time and asked basic questions. Gave clear timeline of hiring process and next steps. The interview lasted approximately thirty minutes
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: There is no interviewing process to get this job. Candidates are chosen by faculty based on academic performance and participation in classes. Those interested can ask the appropriate faculty member for more information about the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone and successfully received the option to come to campus for an onsite interview.  Following the onsite interview I was invited back to meet with another group of team members.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the future?  How would you describe your leadership style?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward process. Sought out researchers in fields of interest and engaged them via e-mail or in person when possible.  Written proposal and a presentation on said proposal. In-person discussion of previous work and interests.
Interview Questions: A brief research proposal was required to stake out specific details of work.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email regarding a phone interview, so a time and date was set. I was contacted that day and was interviewed by four kind ladies. Their mode of interviewing by phone was speakerphone though and it was a bit distracting with everyone talking and asking questions and answering questions. It was pleasant and no-pressure.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with very upset students or parents?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: No interview is required for graduate study, formally i had to apply online, once i got accepted i had to finish all the paperworks  including visa, then i came for study. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: will i accept the offer?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was actually late due to being pulled over, but they laughed with me and didn't seem to mind and understood things happen. There were 3 hiring managers that sat in a conference room to ask questions. Professional but made me feel relaxed and they were easy to talk with. Interview went fast so not sure if that is good or bad.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a fussy patient

title: Executive Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was one phone interview, and two in-person interviews as receiving interviewing questions via email. I personally felt that the interview process for this position was over-kill. I was asked the same questions by different team members, almost as if they did not communicate prior to establishing the interview time frames, etc...and honestly, I was disappointed that I was never contacted to explain why I was not selected so I could improve or to tell me that I was not selected. It is almost like it just died off which I felt was odd since the interview process was so heavy and happened so rapid pace.
Interview Questions: Greatest achievement, asked about budget, how I as an employee worked with others and handling customers, how i would manage my time and projects, some questions in regards to what MS Suite i currently used, experience managing multiple accounts, etc..

title: Data Science Industrial Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Louisville (DeKalb, IL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Hired on the basis of data analytics project. Which is very similar to the intern project. The project is about analyzing the data of diabetes from the medical hospital from 2010 -2017 in the United States of America
Interview Questions: Responsibility of data sciences intern

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: over the phone gave you the questions before hand got to pick time you wanted to interview two people on the phone interviewing you at once very friendly and nice
Interview Questions: how would you handle a difficult situation on campus

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview, which was very difficult.  You are interviewed by two individuals who ask rapid fire questions and expect immediate responses without any time for processing of the question itself.
Interview Questions: The questions asked were typical questions that had obviously been obtained from an internet source.  I was asked about my current position, where do I see myself in five years, to describe an instance each of a time when I was successful and when I was unsuccessful in my working career.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple.  Tell us about yourself.  Include some moments where you had to troubleshoot problems in the past.  Tell us about a negative situation that you had to deal with in a workplace.  Tell us some details in regards to your schooling.  Tell us about some difficulties faced in college.  What is your favorite subject.
Interview Questions: Where I would like to go in future.

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: "So how did you do when you took the class?" "I got an A." "Okay you're hired. Let's go get the paperwork filled out." That was the whole interview.
Interview Questions: What did you get in the class?

title: Stacks Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume online, and then interviewed in-person. Phone calls and emails were exchanged to get the interview set up. A single interview was done at the University of Louisville Ekstrom Library department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: A formal interview process consisting of a phone screen and in-person interview. A group of 2-3 individuals participated in the in-person interview, then you met with the department head for which you would be working.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Resident Assistant Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and laid back, but they prefer you rob dress business professional. There were two people to ask you questions that sometimes were repeated but in a different context. They were somehow difficult if you didn't do your homework.
Interview Questions: Why are you a great candidate

title: REACH Level II Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and easy questions. They do not try to stump you really. They just want to make sure you are capable of explaining the material to your peers and that you have a decent personality.
Interview Questions: How would you explain the AC method?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was professional and enjoyable. They were very accommodating and communicated expectations clearly. The management were even open to some of my specific questions via email beforehand and responded to all inquiries in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience advising students and difficult situations in advising and how I had addressed them.

title: Speech-Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time. Began in June, didn't start until end of October. Could be due to fact that the job was made for me within the department, due to outstanding resume. Also an interdepartmental tragedy occurred during my interview process that slowed down response time.
Interview Questions: What standardized tests am I familiar with administering? What new ideas could I bring to the program?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through university website, was contacted within a few weeks of applying. Interview was great, they answered questions and showed me facilities. Interview style will varying depending on which department you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Describe past job experience

title: Part-Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: No interview since I had taught as a Graduate teaching assistant for the department for several years. I received an offer by e-mail with a contract attached. I accepted the offer by signing the contract and giving them my direct deposit information.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: In depth discussion of necessary qualifications and jobs requirements. Included discussing previous coursework, performance in courses, work with other professors, future career goals, and relevant experience. Also discussed likely job duties and responsibilities. Ended with a discussion of the particular classes I would be a graduate teaching assistant in, how many hours per week I was expected to work, what my salary would be, etc.
Interview Questions: Future Career Goals?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Louisville in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple. Came in met with the interviewer and answered some questions regarding the position. Once I accepted the position it took over two months to get paperwork through HR and finally receive my start date.
Interview Questions: Just task specific questions, i.e. how do you feel about making phone calls to various people.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Before a student is accepted as a STEM teaching assistant, the program leader will determine eligibility based on a few basic pre-requesites. Performance evaluation is based on Departmental grades and participation.
Interview Questions: What are your grades and availability looking like?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, was contacted for the position through my graduate school, met with supervisor once and got the position, the position is easy to get if your graduate school is connected to the department you are applying to
Interview Questions: Simple and standard, tell about myself, interests, why I wanted the position, etc.

title: Administrative Specialist (Division of Cardiovascular Medicine) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
8/5/14: Referred to the position by an employee. Applied.
8/28/14: Contacted by office representative. Scheduled first interview.
9/4/14: I confirmed and attended the first interview.
9/25/14: Contacted by office representative to schedule second interview. I responded but we needed more time than one day could afford to coordinate schedules.
9/26/14: Scheduled second interview.
10/8/14: I confirmed and attended the second interview.  I was told at the end by the second interviewer to expect the search to "wrap up in a few days." I e-mailed the conductor of the first interview to let her know that the second interview went well.
11/6/14: I e-mailed the conductor of the first interview to request an update. She responded that the search was re-opened by the second interviewer to new candidates but still ongoing and that previous candidates have not been ruled out. I was told that the office hoped to select someone "by next week" (11/14 at the latest).
12/16/14: I e-mailed the conductor of the first interview to notify her that I was no longer interested. As of 12/20/14, no response has been given. I have not heard from a representative since 11/6/2014 despite being told on 10/8 to expect a decision around 10/14/14, then being told on 11/6 to expect a decision around 11/14.
Interview Questions: Strengths/weaknesses

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: I found out about the position on the day the application was due. I was very qualified for the position and had a recommendation from the person in charge of making the hiring decision. I filled out the application and received notification that I had received the job a few weeks later. There was no interview. It was a quick and easy process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and was contacted for an interview one week later. The interview went very smoothly and the supervisor was courteous, professional, and showed interest in who I was and what I was looking for. The supervisors office was a little cluttered and very small but they were in the process of re-locating.
Interview Questions: Do you know anything about electrophysiology?

title: Dental Clinic Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY)
Interview Descriptions: Initial emailing back and forth with supervisor.  Came in for "interview," which turned into an overwhelming tour of the entire dental school.  Received phone call within a few days offering me the job.
Interview Questions: Wasn't really much of an interview.  Supervisor asked a few questions regarding my resume and past work experience.  Then dove right into trying to overwhelm me with a tour of every inch of the building.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed to set up a time to speak with my future supervisor, asked range of standard questions.  Was then scheduled for a second interview with many of the Unit Business Managers in the department.
Interview Questions: Describe an accomplishment from a previous position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was daily easy and quick, took just over two weeks. Resume and cover letter were required as well as a criminal background check. Once that was processed the actual interview was formal but no intimidating, behavioral questions were not asked, and overall it was a very good experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Unit Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Communication was great- interviewed with at least 2 managers.  People were friendly and easy to talk with.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening first. Asked a few questions like why do you want to work here and why are you applying for the position.  Then had a face to face interview. Each interviewer asked few questions and answers were not very difficult. Got to meet all the people in the office.
Interview Questions: How did you handle conflict?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews. Took at least 2 months to be hired. Be prepared to meet with various departments. Keep in mind, the university is very political and the leadership is controls who's in and who's out of the conversation. Also be prepared to be a team players and not rock the boat. If you do, you can be blacklisted and any chance of promotion will be gone.
Interview Questions: Do you have fundraising experience? You may have numerous panel interviews with varies departments so be prepared to answer the same questions repeatedly. They will verify your background, criminal record and education. They will not require a drug test.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first, then on campus was two days long--included a real estate tour but no campus tour. Students were included in the interview process but were underprepared--no CV, no background on me as a candidate. But they were candid about their experiences, which were positive. Negotiations were solely with the dean.
Interview Questions: What courses in the curriculum would I not be comfortable teaching.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of 4 people, they took turns asking me questions. They asked questions about my previous experience. They asked questions regarding why I wanted to work for the University. They asked me to tell them about myself .
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was not very difficult.First we talked on the phone, was asked just some personal and technique questions.Most of the questions are related with the new research and new life style in the new place.Then we had on-site interview, talked about some details about the research plan and skills.The most important thing was to present the interest, knowledge and skills I had and how they will be suitable for the new position.
Interview Questions: What is your big shortcoming?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Interview face to face
They called me and set up a meeting to interview me. there were two interviews in the interview room. To be qualified for the job you have at least a GPA of 3.0 and be enrolled part time or full time at the University of Louisville.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Clinical Chemistry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Written application and then a series of one on one interviews and a phone interview. You submit your CV and if they are interested they will ask you to give a phone interview, following that you then have an onsite interview with all of the faculty. Each interview is one on one, followed by a presentation. The presentation is a little like a dissertation defense
Interview Questions: Describe why you want to enter the field and how does your background help you

title: Food Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal, held in the head researcher's office, we discussed personal life and previous work experiences for both of us and what my goals were after graduation. Manager seemed very interested in helping me get experience that would look good on my resume for my particular field.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, interviewed in person.  Went through 4 different interviews, one was a panel interview with 4 people.  The interviews were casual, interviewers were prepared with written questions and I felt all questions were appropriate.  I was given the salary range on the interview.  The entire process from start to finish was 3+ weeks.
Interview Questions: What type of job did i enjoy doing the most.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: You just interview with the primary investigator. If they like you then you are hired. You usually start once you finish the background check and submit all the required documents like diploma. Then you meet with hr and do the on boarding then the next day you start in your role
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and past employment

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a decent interview, consisted of a phone interview first and was a very laid back interview on the phone. In person interview was okay, the Vice president was not very nice to me during the interview and did not even shake my hand after the interview as he wandered off. He did not understand what I was applying for and was very accusatory.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work here?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: long time ago I got schoolarship from JB speed school
Interview Questions: Study plan and GT score

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had nice interview
Interview Questions: Did not have Unexpected questions

title: Graduate Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Louisville in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Admission is based on GRE and Toefl scores. The highest scores are reviewed and scholarships are awarded based on research experience and potential. It comes with the stipulation of maintaining a minimum 3.5 GPA and ability to clear the department's qualifying examinations.
Interview Questions: 4 hour long qualifier examination!

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. You just interview and then work with human resources.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can do this job?

title: Graduate Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Louisville (Louisville, KY) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: Toefl and GRE scores, Recommendation letters, Detailed Application packet.
Interview Questions: None
